that most faults are only small, but important ones

preambulatory.contentExt: You can also continue with the clause after a single block of subclauses! This can only be done once per clause and onyl if at least one subclause is present.

preambulatory.content: of the fact that, under normal conditions, the content of a resolution has a more important and meaningful role than it has in this resolution

operative.content: that writing a resolution can be problematic because delegates might have problems in operating
all delegates to use only so much paper as it is necessary by writing in Times New Roman, always in size 12
that there has to be a comma at the end of a perambulatory clause and a semicolon at the end of an operative one, with a comma after subordinated phrases in the middle
